result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: $20,000.00 signature bond Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. No entry into any Class B licensed establishments. 08:49 AM Defendant NOAH B. JONES appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Elisabeth Lynn Stockbridge appeared by video for NOAH B. JONES. C. Gamm sworn and testifies. Witness identifies Defendant. Cross by Atty. Stockbridge. Court finds probable cause and binds over. Atty. Stockbridge presents bond mod. State objects. Court will amend bond to $2000 cash and $25000 signature bond with conditions Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. No possession of Alcohol No entry into any Class B licensed establishments. No travel outside the state without prior court approval. No possession of marijuana. Not operate a motor vehicle for the pendency of the case. Court orders Amy Jones to sign $20,000 signature surety bond.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
